items.text: Go to AWS root account > Services > IAM.
Click 'Add user' under Users, select 'Access key - Programmatic access', and attach the 'ReadOnlyAccess' policy.
Save the generated access key and secret key for later use.
items.tooltip: Since this is a ReadOnlyAccess, we won't create any resources on your AWS account

parameter_form.title: The access key ID for your AWS account
The secret access key for your AWS account
Costs and usage (CE)
parameter_form.help:
Monitor all instances:
If overall tags are specified below, then all service instances will be filtered by those tags. Otherwise, all instances will be collected.

Monitor instances with explicit AWS service tags ignoring overall tag filters:
Specify explicit tags for these services. The overall tags will be ignored for these services.

Monitor instances with explicit service names ignoring overall tag filters:
Use this option to specify explicit names. The overall tags will be ignored for these services.

Monitor instances with explicit service names ignoring overall tag filters:

parameter_form.title: Define host assignment
parameter_form.help: Define the host to assign the discovered CloudFront services. You can assign them to the AWS host as any other AWS service or to a piggyback host that will be named as the 'Origin Domain' specified in the CloudFront distribution - in case you select the second option, you will have to create the piggyback host(s)

elements.name: domain_host
elements.title: Assign services to piggyback host(s) named as the 'Origin Domain' configured in AWS

elements.name: tags
elements.title: Monitor instances with explicit AWS service tags ignoring overall tag filters

parameter_form.title: Request metrics
parameter_form.help: In order to monitor S3 request metrics, you have to enable request metrics in the AWS/S3 console, see the AWS/S3 documentation. This is a paid feature. Note that the filter name has to be set to EntireBucket, as is recommended in the documentation for a filter that applies to all objects. The special agent will use this filter name to query S3 request metrics from the AWS API.
